Package dev.gruncan.spotify.objects.albums

Class SimplifiedAlbum

java.lang.Object
dev.gruncan.spotify.webapi.objects.albums.SimplifiedAlbum
All Implemented Interfaces:
SpotifyObject, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Album, SimplifiedArtistAlbum, TrackAlbum
public class SimplifiedAlbum extends Object implements SpotifyObject
Represents a spotify SimplifiedAlbumObject

  • Method Details

    • getAlbumType

      public String getAlbumType()
      The type of the album.

    • getTotalTracks

      public int getTotalTracks()
      The number of tracks in the album.

    • getMarkets

      public Country[] getMarkets()
      The markets in which the album is available: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes. NOTE: an album is considered available in a market when at least 1 of its tracks is available in that market.

    • getExternalUrls

      public String getExternalUrls()
      Known external URLs for this album.
      The Spotify URL for the object.

    • getHref

      public String getHref()
      A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the album.

    • getId

      public String getId()
      The Spotify ID for the album.

    • getImages

      public SpotifyImage[] getImages()
      The cover art for the album in various sizes, widest first.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      The name of the album. In case of an album takedown, the value may be an empty string

    • getReleaseDate

      public String getReleaseDate()
      The date the album was first released.

    • getReleaseDatePrecision

      public String getReleaseDatePrecision()
      The precision with which release_date value is known.

    • getRestrictions

      public String getRestrictions()
      Included in the response when a content restriction is applied.
      The reason for the restriction. Albums may be restricted if the content is not available in a given market, to the user's subscription type, or when the user's account is set to not play explicit content. Additional reasons may be added in the future.

    • getType

      public String getType()
      The object type.

    • getUri

      public String getUri()
      The Spotify URI for the album.

    • getCopyrights

      public SpotifyCopyright[] getCopyrights()
      The copyright statements of the album.

    • getExternalIDS

      public SpotifyExternalID getExternalIDS()
      Known external IDs for the album.

    • getGenres

      public String[] getGenres()
      A list of the genres the album is associated with. If not yet classified, the array is empty.

    • getLabel

      public String getLabel()
      The label associated with the album.

    • getPopularity

      public int getPopularity()
      The popularity of the album. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.

    • setAlbumType

      public void setAlbumType(String albumType)
      The type of the album.

    • setTotalTracks

      public void setTotalTracks(int totalTracks)
      The number of tracks in the album.

    • setMarkets

      public void setMarkets(Country[] markets)
      The markets in which the album is available: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes. NOTE: an album is considered available in a market when at least 1 of its tracks is available in that market.

    • setExternalUrls

      public void setExternalUrls(String externalUrls)
      Known external URLs for this album.
      The Spotify URL for the object.

      A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the album.

      public void setId(String id)
      The Spotify ID for the album.

      The cover art for the album in various sizes, widest first.

      The name of the album. In case of an album takedown, the value may be an empty string

      public void setReleaseDate(String releaseDate)
      The date the album was first released.

      public void setReleaseDatePrecision(String releaseDatePrecision)
      The precision with which release_date value is known.

    • setRestrictions

      public void setRestrictions(String restrictions)
      Included in the response when a content restriction is applied.
      The reason for the restriction. Albums may be restricted if the content is not available in a given market, to the user's subscription type, or when the user's account is set to not play explicit content. Additional reasons may be added in the future.
